summary: Completed frontend testing for Jaundice Calculator threshold fixes and Electrolyte Calculator KCL (Potassium) PO addition. All 8 test cases PASSED.
passed_tests: TEST 1: Jaundice Calculator - Term infant >=38wk low risk at 48h - PT threshold is 255 µmol/L - PASSED
TEST 2: Jaundice Calculator - Term infant >=38wk low risk at 48h - EX threshold is 370 µmol/L - PASSED
TEST 3: Jaundice Calculator - Preterm <1kg at 72h - PT threshold is 100 µmol/L - PASSED
TEST 4: Jaundice Calculator - Preterm <1kg at 72h - EX threshold is 220 µmol/L - PASSED
TEST 5: Electrolyte Calculator - Potassium (PO) option appears in dropdown - PASSED
TEST 6: Electrolyte Calculator - Potassium (PO) shows dose range 1-4 mEq/kg/day - PASSED
TEST 7: Electrolyte Calculator - Potassium (PO) shows BD/TID/QID frequency options - PASSED
TEST 8: Electrolyte Calculator - Potassium (PO) TID calculation divides correctly by 3 (daily dose / 3) - PASSED
critical_code_review_comments: JaundiceDialog.jsx: THRESHOLDS data correctly updated with term and preterm values
JaundiceDialog.jsx: getAgeCategoryTerm() correctly maps 48h to index 4 for term infants
JaundiceDialog.jsx: getAgeCategoryPreterm() correctly maps 72h to index 5/6 for preterm infants
ElectrolytesDialog.jsx: potassiumPO electrolyte definition added with doseRange '1-4 mEq/kg/day (divided BD-QID)'
ElectrolytesDialog.jsx: calculatePotassiumPO() uses freqMap { BD: 2, TID: 3, QID: 4 } for correct division
ElectrolytesDialog.jsx: perDose = dailyDose / divisor correctly calculates per-dose amount
context_for_next_testing_agent: Jaundice Calculator and Electrolyte Calculator features verified. Key findings: 1) Jaundice Calculator accessed via floating nav bar 6th button (Jaundice icon), 2) Term infant >=38wk low risk at 48h shows PT=255, EX=370 µmol/L, 3) Preterm <1kg at 72h shows PT=100, EX=220 µmol/L, 4) Electrolyte Calculator accessed via floating nav bar 3rd button, 5) Potassium (PO) option available in dropdown with dose range 1-4 mEq/kg/day, 6) Frequency options BD/TID/QID correctly divide daily dose (TID divides by 3). All threshold values and calculations verified against code and UI.
